data.title: Capra Bank
data.meta_description: Ready to make an impact. You deserve a partner that helps you reach new heights. We employ elite bankers who are driven by a desire to elevate our clients and communities.
data.text:
Tut Fuller is the Founder, Chairman and CEO of Capra Bank. He founded Capra Bank, after he successfully acquired Peoples Savings Bank and launched operations headquartered in Dubuque in April 2023.

Taking his wealth of family and personal banking experience, Fuller is building a bank that delivers something extra to the clients and communities it serves. He believes in building a true team, where elite talent works together to achieve a common goal and help others reach new heights. Fuller knows that combining top-notch talent with modern technology can give clients the edge they deserve. And when a bank is built on a foundation of integrity, making local decisions that benefit the local community, it can have a positive ripple effect that elevates everyone.

Prior to this, Tut held many different roles within the financial industry including CEO of DB&T and being HTLF’s Regional President over banks in Wisconsin, Illinois, Iowa, Kansas, and Texas totaling ~$10B in assets. He also concurrently led M&A integration, Strategic planning, oversaw both Consumer Banking and Marketing EVPs, and led a project to generate ~$50 million dollars of cost savings at HTLF.

Fuller lives in Dubuque with his wife, Ali, and their three children. He’s an avid outdoorsman and adventurer, with a passion for exploring and viewing the world from a new perspective.

With a banking career spanning four decades, Greg Garland has experienced the ebbs and flows of the financial industry and navigated them with impressive precision resulting in enviable success. A proud graduate of Texas Tech University, he spent his entire banking career in Lubbock and was instrumental in building a prominent community bank from the ground up.

In his daily work Greg is responsible for steering the strategic direction and driving growth in the Lubbock market for Capra Bank. As the leader of the talented team of Texas bankers, he provides guidance, helps establish and monitors the bank’s financial objectives, and helps customers reach new peaks in their personal and business lives.

In his free time, he remains active in the non-profit community. However, his favorite pastime is spending time with his beautiful bride of 40 years, three daughters, son-in-law, and three grandchildren. Greg also closely follows Red Raider Sports and loves time with family at the lake.

This Texas Tech sports fan is no stranger to success with a banking career highlighted by accomplishments over nearly 30 years. Working his way through the ranks, Tim found his passion in commercial lending where he’s helped numerous businesses across West Texas achieve new heights.

In his role, Tim oversees lending operations by ensuring loan quality and supporting the strategic goals of the bank while providing guidance to the lending team.

Anyone that knows Tim will tell you that he is a sports enthusiast! He enjoys cheering on his daughters at sporting events, watching the Texas Tech Red Raiders, and of course, he’s a fan of the Dallas Cowboys. Married for 20 years, Tim has two daughters and enjoys sports and hunting in his free time.

Dan has spent two decades serving commercial banking clients in the Dubuque area. At Capra Bank, he is the primary point of contact helping local businesses navigate their banking and lending needs. Over the course of his career, Dan has learned that a strong local banking presence is critical to helping a community thrive. He is passionate about working for a bank where decisions are made locally and in the best interests of clients. Dan resides in Dubuque with his wife, Aimee, and their four children. He has held key positions for multiple community nonprofit organizations including the Boys and Girls Club of Greater Dubuque, Holy Family Catholic Schools, and Greater Dubuque Development Corp.

This seasoned banker has spent two decades serving customers in West Texas. With a proven track record of excellence, Matt is passionate about creating financial resources and tools to help his customers elevate to new levels of success. As an entrepreneur himself, he knows what it takes to support his customers with the right financial tools.

Matt works directly with Tim to generate new commercial business, support the bank’s strategic goals, and guide the commercial team.

He stays committed to the Lubbock community through frequent volunteerism and is an avid Texas Tech sports fan. In his free time Matt enjoys hunting with his dogs and spending time at the ranch.

Josh helps local businesses navigate all their banking and lending needs. This includes credit, treasury management, and other solutions to help their businesses grow. He brings over 10 years of experience in the banking industry, primarily in the Dubuque market. Josh is currently pursuing an MBA and is a past participant of leadership development programs including Leadership Dubuque, the Dardis Academy, and the Dale Carnegie Leadership Program. He obtained his Iowa Banking Association’s Commercial Banking certificate. Josh believes in giving back and actively serves on the YMCA Dubuque Board, Greater Dubuque Development Corp. Future Leaders, Aquin Finance Board, and the Two by Two Development Committee. He also participates in the 100+ Men Who Care initiative. Josh resides in Cascade with his wife, Molly, and their children, Grayson and Jordy.

This seasoned banker and busy dad graduated from Abilene Christian University, double majoring in accounting and finance. In 2011, Dustin began his career in banking with a focus on credit and lending. He quickly progressed through the ranks, gaining invaluable insights into credit analysis, risk management, and loan structuring before finding his calling as a commercial banker. His lending experience spans multiple industries including wholesale, manufacturing, commercial real estate, medical, and agriculture, however his specialty is in the sector of industrial lending. Dustin enjoys seeing his customers and their businesses thrive, so he applies his knowledge and experience to find the right solutions to elevate their business to the next level.

Dustin stays active in the community, having volunteered at several organizations over the years including Rotary, Young Professionals, County Fair Board, and Meals on Wheels. He has been married for 13 years and has two children, active in school and sports, as well as two furry family members. He lives each day by the words of the wise Tim McGraw who said, “Always stay humble and kind.”

This West Texas native and graduate of Texas Tech University began his banking career in 2002. Using his determination, natural talent, and knack for business Jared quickly moved through the ranks, holding different positions in several departments, before finally finding his place as a commercial banker. As a local community banker, Jared has helped numerous local businesses access opportunities and find success.

Jared is actively involved in his local church and the charitable community, having served on a number of non-profit boards over the years. Jared has been married to his lovely bride Ashley for 20 years. Together they have two sons, a daughter-in-law, and will soon welcome a grandchild. In his free time Jared enjoys hunting, hiking, and golfing.

Capra Bank is proud to have this sports fan and busy dad on its roster! After graduating from Texas Tech University in 2007 with his degree in business administration, Colton immediately started his career in the banking industry. He showed particular interest in lending and held positions in underwriting and credit before working his way to commercial banker. During the span of his career, Colton has helped numerous businesses, big and small, spanning many different industries, find success by offering the right solutions and personalized service.

Colton’s dedication extends to the community as well. He currently serves on the Shallowater Youth Football Board, and he is a director for the Shallowater Education Foundation which raises an impressive sum each year for the community’s public school system.

Colton and his lovely wife Lindsey live in Shallowater and have three energetic boys that stay very busy with sports. And somehow Colton finds the time to coach his sons’ teams as well!

This Texas Tech fan, seasoned banker, and West Texas native is your go-to for all things Treasury Management. With a banking career spanning nearly 30 years, Vince has the experience, knowledge, and drive to help his clients reach their next peak. Vince earned his undergraduate degree in business management at Texas Tech University and continued his education at Wayland where he completed his master’s program in human resource management. Vince is a talented banker as well as a small business owner, allowing him to understand the needs of Capra Bank’s customers.

He stays active in the non-profit community through frequent volunteerism and serves on the Covenant Foundation Hospital Board as the finance committee vice chair. In his free time, he enjoys spending time with Jessica, hanging out with his son Vance who is currently attending Texas State, working at his bar, Shotgun Sue’s, and hunting.
